tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This means ‘recite, paying full attention to the import of the content’. When recited like this, a two-way process between Quran and its reciter comes into play
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 5?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Literally ‘weighty words’ refers to that order for giving warning which is mentioned in the next chapter, ‘Arise and give warning’ ( 74:2 ). This means inform people about the hazards of the Hereafter
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In such conditions, the only Being whom the preacher of Truth finds as his sympathiser and supporter is his Lord. In the path of the mission of Truth, strewn as it is with difficulties, this is the only real weapon which the missionary has
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who do not bow down before the missionary of God in this world, run the risk of having to bow down before God’s punishment in the Hereafter. The arrival of a prophet was meant to ensure that the distinction between Truth and falsehood was clearly understood and that, finally, the Truth was ...

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Muzzammil, Ayah 20?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This is the test of a man’s devoutness to see how many more good deeds he performs, thus making himself eligible for greater rewards. The compulsory duties in religion have been set forth in terms of the common man’s capabilities
